diff_hunk:
@@ -87,6 +87,10 @@
 #   TF_DOCKER_BUILD_OPTIONS
 #     (Optional)
 #     Specifies the desired build options. Defaults to OPT.
+#
+#   TF_BAZEL_BUILD_OPTIONS
body: Correct. We have scripts internally that use it. tensorflow/tools/ci_build/linux/cpu/run_mkl.sh could (and probably should) use it. Right now, that script just takes default compiler x86 optimizations. tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_parameterized_build.sh has a TF_BUILD_OPTIONS parameter that is close, but doesn't give our scripts the flexibility they need.
body_html: Correct. We have scripts internally that use it. tensorflow/tools/ci_build/linux/cpu/run_mkl.sh could (and probably should) use it. Right now, that script just takes default compiler x86 optimizations. tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_parameterized_build.sh has a TF_BUILD_OPTIONS parameter that is close, but doesn't give our scripts the flexibility they need.
body_text: Correct. We have scripts internally that use it. tensorflow/tools/ci_build/linux/cpu/run_mkl.sh could (and probably should) use it. Right now, that script just takes default compiler x86 optimizations. tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_parameterized_build.sh has a TF_BUILD_OPTIONS parameter that is close, but doesn't give our scripts the flexibility they need.
